summary: systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is an autoimmune chronic systemic disease. it can involve several organs such as skin, lungs, brain and heart. pleuritis, pneumonia, pulmonary embolism, pneumothorax and pulmonary haemorrhage are most common causes of admission to the ICU and fatal outcome in these patients. patient was afebrile, with HR 70/min, respiratory rate 16/min, pO2 64.0 mmHg, pCO2 28.4 mmHg, Sat 93.1%. she has been transferred to the ICU, required endotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation. the level of pANA was 1:2560. the patient's condition gradually improved and she was extubated. antibiotics have been changed to levofloxacine and amikacin. fulminant lupus pneumonitis is a rare but life threatening complication of SLE. pulmonary manifestations of SLE can include pleuritis, pneumonia, pulmonary embolism, pneumothorax and pulmonary haemorrhage. study group has been diagnosed with noninfectious pneumonitis. one patient was confirmed to have coronavirus pneumonia. the other had fulminant lupus pneumonitis. plasmapheresis, dialysis and immunosuppressive therapy were useful. authors declare that they have no competing interests. authors' contributions MK analyzed and interpreted patient data regarding the pulmonary disease. AA analyzed and interpreted patient data regarding the rheumatological disease and results of HRCT.
